alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:31PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 600 PM MST... At 530 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White Tank Mountain Park, or 7 miles west of Sun City West, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, El Mirage, Wittmann, Sun City West, Circle City, Waddell, Surprise Stadium, White Tank Mountain Park, Morristown and Beardsley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 120 and 142. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 1 and 11. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 110 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
